metadata: (info { (description "Tsi-Di'l is a race game played by Navajo women. Typically, a cloth was stretched over the players, which would prevent the sticks from flying away when they were thrown against the central rock.") (aliases {"Tsin-Di'l"}) (rules "A number of stones, arranged in a square. The spaces between the stones are the playing spaces. Players play with sticks, which moves through the playing spaces. Three sticks, used as dice.") (source "DLP evidence.") (id "845") (version "1.3.14") (classification "board/race/reconstruction/pending") (credit "Eric Piette") (origin "This game was played in Navajo, around 1897.") } ) (graphics { (show Edges (colour Hidden)) })
